pages.title: About
pages.content:
About KnowledgeBase

KnowledgeBase is the documentation platform for modern software teams. We provide comprehensive guides, API references, and tutorials to help developers build amazing products.

Our documentation is written by engineers, for engineers. Every guide includes working code examples, common pitfalls, and best practices drawn from real-world experience.

pages.title: Getting Started
pages.content:
Quick Start Guide

Get up and running in under 5 minutes with this step-by-step guide.

Step 1: Installation

Install the CLI tool using npm:

npm install -g knowledgebase-cli

Step 2: Initialize

Create a new project in your working directory:

kb init my-docs\ncd my-docs

Step 3: Configure

Edit the kb.config.json file with your project details.

Step 4: Deploy

Push to production with a single command:

kb deploy --production

That's it! Your documentation is now live.

pages.title: API Reference
pages.content:
REST API Reference

Our REST API allows you to programmatically manage your documentation, users, and integrations.

Authentication

All API requests require a Bearer token:

Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY

Base URL

https://api.knowledgebase.dev/v2

Endpoints

GET /docs — List all documents
POST /docs — Create a document
GET /docs/:id — Get a document
PUT /docs/:id — Update a document
DELETE /docs/:id — Delete a document

Rate Limits

Free tier: 100 requests/minute. Pro: 1,000 requests/minute. Enterprise: Custom.

pages.title: FAQ
pages.content:
Frequently Asked Questions

Is KnowledgeBase free?

Yes! Our free tier includes unlimited public docs, 3 team members, and community support.

Can I use my own domain?

Absolutely. Custom domains are available on Pro and Enterprise plans.

What about versioning?

We support full document versioning with diff tracking, branching, and rollback capabilities.

Is there an API?

Yes, our REST API gives you full programmatic access. See our API Reference.

How do I migrate from other platforms?

We offer one-click importers for GitBook, Notion, Confluence, and Markdown files. Contact support for custom migrations.

articles.title: Building Great Documentation: A Practical Guide
articles.content:
Great documentation doesn't happen by accident. It requires the same rigor and intentionality as great code. Here's our framework for building docs that developers actually want to read.

Start with empathy: understand what your users are trying to accomplish, not what your product does. Structure your docs around user goals, not feature lists.
